data.name: DragonBornTraitsLabel.Text
data.value:
Dragonborn Traits
Str +2, Cha +1 Age: adult by 15, lifespan 3-80
Size: 6+ft, 250lbs, Medium Speed: 30ft
Ancestry: Draconic Your breath weapon and damage resistance are determined by the dragon type.

data.name: DwarfTraitsLabel.Text
data.value:
Dwarf Traits
Str +2, Con +2 Age: adult by 50, lifespan 0-350
Size: 4-5ft, 150lbs, Medium Speed: 25ft
Dwarven Resilience You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

data.name: ElfTraitsLabel.Text
data.value:
Elf Traits
Dex +2, Int +1 Age: adult by 100, lifespan 0-750
Size: 5-6ft, 150lbs, Medium Speed: 30ft
Fey Ancestry You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put you to sleep.

data.name: HalfElfTraitsLabel.Text
data.value:
Half - Elf Traits
Cha +2, 2 +1 choice Age: adult by 20, lifespan 0-180
Size: 5-6ft, 150lbs, Medium Speed: 30ft
Fey Ancestry You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put you to sleep.

data.name: HalfOrcTraitsLabel.Text
data.value:
Half - Orc Traits
Str +2, Con +1 Age: adult by 14 lifespan 0-75
Size: 5-6ft, 200lbs, Medium Speed: 30ft
Relentless Endurance When you are reduced to 0 HP you can drop to 1 HP instead, once per long rest.

data.name: HalflingTraitsLabel.Text
data.value:
Halfling Traits
Dex +2 Age: adult by 20 lifespan 0-250
Size: 3ft, 40lbs, Small Speed: 25ft
Lucky When you roll a 1 on a d20 for attack rolls, ability checks, or saving throws, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

data.name: HumanTraitsLabel.Text
data.value:
Human Traits
All +1 Age: adult by 20 lifespan 0-75
Size: 5-6ft, 150lbs, Medium Speed: 30ft
House choice In choosing a house, you gain certain features depending on your ethnicity.

data.name: GnomeTraitsLabel.Text
data.value:
Gnome Traits
INT +2 Age: adult by 40 lifespan 0-500
Size: 3-4ft, 40lbs, Small Speed: 25ft
Gnome Cunning You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

data.name: TieflingTraitsLabel.Text
data.value:
Tiefling Traits
int +1, cha +2 Age: adult by 20 lifespan 0-100
Size: 5-6ft, 180lbs, Medium Speed: 30ft
Hellish Resistance You have resistance to fire damage.

data.name: AarakocraTraitsLabel.Text
data.value:
aarakocra Traits
dex +2, wis +1 Age: adult by 3, lifespan 0-30
Size: 5ft, 80-100lbs, Medium Speed: 25ft
Flight You have a flying speed of 50 feet. To use this speed, you can’t be wearing medium or heavy armor.
Talons You are proficient with your unarmed strikes, which deal 1d4 slashing damage on a hit.

data.name: BarbarianLabel.Text
data.value: Barbarians are defined by their rage: unbridled, unquenchable, and unthinking fury. More than a mere emotion, their anger is the ferocity of a cornered predator, the unrelenting assault of a storm, the churning turmoil of the sea.

data.name: WizardLabel.Text
data.value: Wizards are supreme magic-users, defined and united as a class by the spells they cast. Drawing on the subtle weave of magic that permeates the cosmos, wizards cast spells of explosive fire, arcing lightning, subtle deception, and brute-force mind control.

data.name: WarlockLabel.Text
data.value: Warlocks are seekers of the knowledge that lies hidden in the fabric of the multiverse. Through pacts made with mysterious beings of supernatural power, warlocks unlock magical effects both subtle and spectacular.

data.name: RogueLabel.Text
data.value: Rogues rely on skill, stealth, and their foes’ vulnerabilities to get the upper hand in any situation. They have a knack for finding the solution to just about any problem, demonstrating a resourcefulness and versatility that is the cornerstone of any successful adventure

data.name: PaladinLabel.Text
data.value: Whatever their origin and their mission, paladins are united by their oaths to stand against the forces of evil. It is a source of power that turns a devout warrior into a blessed champion.

data.name: FighterLabel.Text
data.value: Questing knights, conquering overlords, royal champions, elite foot soldiers, hardened mercenaries, and bandit kings —as fighters, they all share an unparalleled mastery with weapons and armor, and a thorough knowledge of the skills of combat.

data.name: DruidLabel.Text
data.value: druids are an embodiment of nature’s resilience, cunning, and fury. They claim no mastery over nature. Instead, they see themselves as extensions of nature’s indomitable will.

data.name: ClericLabel.Text
data.value: Clerics are intermediaries between the mortal world and the distant planes of the gods. As varied as the gods they serve, clerics strive to embody the handiwork of their deities. No ordinary priest, a cleric is imbued with divine magic.

data.name: BardLabel.Text
data.value: Whether scholar, skald, or scoundrel, a bard weaves magic through words and music to inspire allies, demoralize foes, manipulate minds, create illusions, and even heal wounds.
